name: For Die-hard Stoogephiles Quiz | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which actor was not a Stooge regular?
questions.explanation:
Tom Conway.

	Both Bud Jamison and Vernon Dent were Christian Scientists who died by refusing to take medication!

questions.text: The theme music for the Stooges shorts consisted of two popular tunes that would alternate from short to short. One of these tunes was 'Three Blind Mice'. What was the other one?
What is the only Stooge short nominated for an Oscar?
questions.explanation:
Men in Black.

	In my opinion, any one of those could have been nominated.

questions.text: What is the only short in which all three Howard brothers (Shemp, Curly, Moe) appeared?
What was significantly different from 'You Nazty Spy' and its sequel 'I'll Never Heil Again'?
questions.correct: Moe's Hitler did not have a mustache
options: Curly was no longer paroding Mussulini
Curly played Von Limburger instead of Von Hossenfeiffer
The setting was Moronica instead of Mickyfinland
questions.explanation:
Moe's Hitler did not have a mustache.

	Personally I think the sequel is the better one.

questions.text: There were two remakes of 'Hoi Polloi', including 'Half-wit's Holiday' and 'Pies and Guys'. Who is the only stooge (of the ones that starred in shorts) that was not in a version of this?
questions.explanation:
Shemp.

	Both 'Hoi Polloi' and 'Half-Wit's Holiday' were Curly shorts. Joe was in 'Pies and Guys', a scene-by-scene remake of 'Hal-Wit's'. Curly-Joe never appeared in any shorts.

questions.text: What is significant about the Shemp short 'Self-made Maids'?
questions.correct: The stooges played every part themselves
options: Shemp was out sick for half the short
It was the last one made with Shemp
questions.explanation:
The stooges played every part themselves.

	Except for a brief appearance of an unidentifird man reading a newspaper, Moe, Larry and Shemp played themselves as well as their girlfriends Moella, Larraine, and Shempetta. Moe also played the girl's father, and Shemp and Larry played characters in a picture hanging on the wall that moves!

questions.text: In 'Cuckoo-On-A-Choo Choo', Larry played a low class, abusive slob who steals a train and is discovered by detective Moe. Larry was paroding a famous actor in a popular play at that time. Who was it?
questions.explanation:
Marlon Brando.

	Larry was doing a takeoff on Brando in 'A Streetcar Named Desire.'

questions.text: Which title is NOT a parody of a popular SONG?
questions.explanation:
So Long, Mr. Chumps

	'So Long, Mr. Chumps' is the parody of the MOVIE 'Goodbye, Mr. Chips.'  There are two taken from SONGS 'In the Sweet By-and-by', and 'I'll Never Smile Again.' 'Swing Low Sweet Charlie' is not a song.

questions.text: When a scene required a pie being thrown in someone's face, who was usually asked by the director to do it?
questions.explanation:
Moe.

	Moe usually had the best aim, so nearly every pie was thrown by him.
